text.section: Unless a license is renewed for a 2-year term as provided in this section, the license expires on a staggered basis as determined by the Secretary.

At least 1 month before a license expires, the Commission shall mail to the licensee, at the last known address of the licensee:
a renewal application form; and
a notice that states:
the date on which the current license expires; and
the amount of the renewal fee.
The Commission shall renew the license of and issue a license to each licensee who meets the requirements of this section.

section.section: The Commission shall adopt regulations to require a demonstration of continuing professional competency of up to 30 educational hours for a licensee as a condition of renewal of a license under this section in accordance with paragraphs (2) through (6) of this subsection.
Continuing professional competency requirements do not apply to the first renewal of a license.
If a license expires on or before September 30, 2013, a licensee is not required to fulfill the continuing professional competency requirements.

If a license expires between October 1, 2013, and September 30, 2014, a licensee is required to fulfill 50% of the continuing professional competency requirements as provided in the regulations adopted by the Commission under this subsection.

If a license expires on or after October 1, 2014, a licensee is required to fulfill the full continuing professional competency requirements as provided in the regulations adopted by the Commission under this subsection.

Educational hours from a continuing professional competency course satisfy the requirement of paragraph (1) of this subsection if:
the course is offered by:
the American Society of Home Inspectors;
the National Association of Home Inspectors; or
any other provider approved by the Commission; and
the Commission determines that the course increases the licensee's knowledge of the provision of home inspection services, including one or more components of an existing residential building.
